articles.title: Special Information Bulletin Issued in Italy
Forcible Evacuation of Residents from Planned Site for Expansion of U.S. Military Base
articles.content:
Special Information Bulletin Issued in Italy 
    Pyongyang, May 7 (KCNA) -- The Group of Dialectical Materialists of Italy issued a special information bulletin on the occasion of the 74th anniversary of the foundation of the Korean People's Army.
 The bulletin said that the anniversary of the KPA marks an occasion of inspiring all the progressive people of the world in their struggle against imperialism.
 It introduced the dynamic struggle against the U.S. moves to stifle the DPRK after the victory in the arduous anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle in Korea.
 It is the appropriate duty of revolutionaries in Europe and the progressive people aspiring after world peace to positively study and disseminate the Juche idea and the Songun idea, it said, stressing the need to give wide publicity to the experience of the Korean people in the anti-U.S. struggle.

articles.title: KPA Anniversary Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Forcible Evacuation of Residents from Planned Site for Expansion of U.S. Military Base 
    Pyongyang, May 7 (KCNA) -- The south Korean "Ministry of National Defence" and police on May 4 began to forcibly evacuate objects from a planned site for expansion of the U.S. military base despite the unanimous denunciation of public circles, south Korean KBS reported.
 At least 3,000 military engineers, more than 11,000 policemen of over 100 companies and about 700 gangsters of a team for evacuation were mobilized in forcible evacuation.
 The crime of the warhawks and pro-U.S. sycophantic elements keen to expand the U.S. military base to support the U.S. policy of aggression and war is evoking the surging resentment of all the fellow countrymen.

articles.title: Moves to Commit Military Force to Phyongthaek Denounced
RS Calls for Training Many Competent Talents
articles.content:
Moves to Commit Military Force to Phyongthaek Denounced 
    Pyongyang, May 7 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification reportedly released a statement on May 3, urging the "Ministry of National Defence" of south Korea to immediately stop committing military force to Phyongthaek.
 It is unpardonable for the ministry to commit military force to Phyongthaek against residents who want to do farming in their own land, the statement said, and went on:
 The struggle to protect Phyongthaek is an expression of all-people resistance targeting the headquarters of the U.S. forces in south Korea, the root cause of evil in the Korean Peninsula.    
 Our people will never yield to any suppression by the "Ministry of National Defence".

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Art Performance
Army Day Celebrated in Different Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Art Performance 
    Pyongyang, May 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, enjoyed an art performance given by the State Symphony Orchestra at the reconstructed Moranbong Theatre. 
 Also among the audience were Kim Kuk Thae and Kim Ki Nam, secretaries of the C.C., WPK, senior officials of the Party and the army and officials in the fields of culture and arts and media.    
 The performers put on the stage colorful numbers including orchestral music "The Sound of a Horse' Hooves in Mt. Paektu" and "Rich Harvest Comes to the Chongsan Plain" and world famous music pieces composed by Tchaikovsky and Shostakovich.
 The performers truthfully represented the unshakable faith and will of the army and people of the DPRK to accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche and the cause of building a great prosperous powerful nation under the uplifted banner of great Songun at any cost and fully demonstrated the validity and vitality of the WPK's literary and art policy of creating, arranging and presenting art works in Korean style from A to Z.
He extended thanks to the creators and artistes of the orchestra, expressing great satisfaction over the successful performance given by them with high artistry. 
 He highly appreciated their successes, noting that they have created a lot of masterpieces deeply loved by the Korean people by firmly maintaining the principle of developing symphonies in Korean style to meet their sentiment. 
 He put forward important tasks that would serve as guidelines in further developing the Juche-based symphonies.

articles.title: Anniversary of ARF Observed in India
articles.content:
Army Day Celebrated in Different Countries 
    Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- Meetings, seminars and reading sessions took place in Bangladesh, India, France and Democratic Congo from April 22 to 28 on the occasion of the 74th birthday of the Korean People's Army.
 Seen on the walls of the venue were portraits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.    
 Displayed there were photographs showing the invincible might of the KPA.
 The chairman of the Central Committee of the Socialist Party of Bangladesh said in his speech made at a meeting that the victory and glorious history of the KPA would be unthinkable without the leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, adding that the KPA would win only victory in the confrontation with the imperialists under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.    
 The director of the Indian Institute for Foreign Policy Studies noted in his speech that the course of sure victory covered by the KPA is a history of their Songun leadership. He explained in detail the undying feats the peerlessly great persons performed by training the KPA into an invincible army and turning the DPRK into an impregnable fortress.
 The director of a vocational school in Democratic Congo said at a reading session that the KPA founded by Kim Il Sung has entered a new stage of its development under the leadership of Kim Jong Il. He praised the KPA for fully demonstrating its might. 
 Participants of the functions watched Korean films including "The 70th Birthday of the Heroic Korean People's Army" and "Korean People's Army, Steel-Strong Ranks."
 Messages of greetings to Kim Jong Il were adopted at the functions held in Bangladesh and India.

articles.title: National Festival of Science and Technology Held
articles.content:
Anniversary of ARF Observed in India 
    Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- A lecture was sponsored by the Indian Youth Group for the Study of Works of Comrade Kim Il Sung on May 1 on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland (ARF).
 At the lecture the chairman of the group explained in detail how the ARF was founded, adding that the ARF was the first national united front body in Korea founded and led by President Kim Il Sung in the period of the anti-Japanese armed struggle. 
He stressed that the idea of the great national unity set out by Kim Il Sung has been successfully carried forward by leader Kim Jong Il and he has glorified Korean-style socialism centered on the popular masses with his unique Songun politics.
 Korea's reunification is bound to come true thanks to the strong will of all the Korean people to defend and implement the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration to the letter, he stressed.

articles.title: S. Koreans Protest against Land Expropriation
RS on Paektu Revolutionary Traditions
articles.content:
S. Koreans Protest against Land Expropriation
    Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The All-People Measure Committee for Checking the Expansion of the U.S. Military Base in Phyongthaek and the Phaengsong Town Measure Committee for Opposing the Expansion of the U.S. Military Base reportedly held a press conference on May 2 to denounce the deceptive "dialogue" of the "Ministry of National Defence" regarding the issue of an area to be designated to expand the U.S. military base.
 At the press conference speakers said that while talking about "dialogue with residents in Phyongthaek", the ministry forced them to "stop farming" and "ensure the project", which is a mockery of the people.    
 A press release, which was read out at the press conference, said that the "dialogue" ballad of the ministry was a deception and delaying tactics to improve its plight driven into a tight corner.
 It noted that the ministry is scheming to shift the blame for delaying "dialogue" onto the residents and staged a preliminary training for land expropriation by mobilizing even a helicopter.
 If the ministry expropriates land in the end, the people will fight against it in a do-or-die spirit and the ministry will be held responsible for all followup developments, it warned.
